keyTakeAways: Novo Nordisk is undergoing a major boardroom restructuring, with seven members, including the chairman, stepping down due to disagreements with its majority shareholder.

The Novo Nordisk Foundation, which holds significant voting power despite owning only 28.1% of shares, has pushed for sweeping governance changes, including the removal of former CEO Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen.
The board's proposal to bring in new members for expanded expertise was rejected in favor of a more extensive reconfiguration, signaling a power struggle between board and shareholder.

Despite being Europe's most-valuable company in 2024 due to high demand for Ozempic and Wegovy, Novo Nordisk faces declining share prices and reduced profit growth forecasts due to competition from US rivals like Eli Lilly.
The company has already taken major steps including cutting 9,000 jobs and launching a cost-savings program in response to market pressures.

Lars Rebien Sorensen, former CEO of Novo Nordisk and current head of the Novo Nordisk Foundation, is being proposed to replace outgoing chairman Helge Lund, suggesting continuity through leadership from the foundation.
The boardroom shake-up reflects broader industry concerns about sustainability and adaptability in the face of increasing competition in the diabetes and weight-loss drug markets.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Novo Nordisk, the maker of Ozempic and Wegovy, is experiencing a major boardroom shake-up with seven members, including chairman Helge Lund and vice chair Henrik Poulsen, stepping down due to a disagreement with its majority shareholder, the Novo Nordisk Foundation. The foundation, which holds significant voting power despite owning only 28.1% of shares, pushed for a more extensive reconfiguration of the board, rejecting a proposal to bring in new members with new skills. This leadership transition follows earlier changes, including the removal of former CEO Lars Fruergaard Jørgensen and the announcement of 9,000 job cuts. Despite being Europe's most-valued company in 2024 due to high demand for its weight-loss drugs, Novo Nordisk has faced declining share prices and reduced profit forecasts due to increasing competition from rivals like Eli Lilly. The proposed appointment of Lars Rebien Sorensen, former CEO of Novo Nordisk and current head of the foundation, to replace Lund reflects the foundation’s strong influence on corporate governance and leadership decisions.
title: Ozempic maker Novo Nordisk's board shaken up as directors quit
